For more info, see here:  
https://scikit-learn.org/stable/datasets/index.html#breast-cancer-wisconsin-diagnostic-dataset

The **breast cancer wisconsin (diagnostic) dataset** is loaded using `load_breast_cancer()`. This returns a 'Bunch' object with the following keys:

| Key | Description |
|-----|-------------------------------------------------------------|
| `DESCR` | Description of the dataset |
| `filename` | Location of the CSV file containing the data being imported |
| `feature_names` | Names of the 30 groups of data |
| `data` | The 569 data points in each of the 30 groups of data, formatted as a 569x30 array |
| `target_names` | Names of the 2 categorisations (malignant and benign) |
| `target` | Which categorisation each data point is in (0, 1) |

```{python}
from sklearn.datasets import load_breast_cancer

# Load the dataset
breast_cancer = load_breast_cancer()

# Show the dataset's keys
print(list(breast_cancer))
```

```{python}
# Description of the dataset
print(breast_cancer['DESCR'])
```

```{python}
# Location of the CSV file containing the data being imported
print(breast_cancer['filename'])
```

```{python}
# Names of the 30 groups of data
print(breast_cancer['feature_names'])
```

```{python}
# The 569 data points in each of the 30 groups of data, formatted as a 569x30 array
print(breast_cancer['data'][:2])
```

```{python}
# Names of the 2 categorisations (malignant and benign)
print(breast_cancer['target_names'])
```

```{python}
# Which categorisation each data point is in (0, 1)
print(breast_cancer['target'][:10])
```

The groups of data can be plotted against each other or against the target
group as follows:

```{python}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# PLOT
plt.scatter(
    breast_cancer['data'][:, 0], breast_cancer['data'][:, 8],
    c=breast_cancer['target']
)
plt.title('Breast cancer wisconsin (diagnostic) dataset')
plt.xlabel(breast_cancer['feature_names'][0])
plt.ylabel(breast_cancer['feature_names'][8])
plt.show()
```

The data is much easier to work with if it is converted to a data frame:

```{python}
import pandas as pd

# CONVERT TO DATA FRAME
breast_cancer_df = pd.DataFrame(
    breast_cancer['data'], columns=breast_cancer['feature_names']
)
breast_cancer_df['Categorisation'] = breast_cancer['target']

# PLOT
plt.scatter(
    breast_cancer_df['mean area'], breast_cancer_df['mean smoothness'],
    c=breast_cancer_df['Categorisation']
)
plt.title('Breast cancer wisconsin (diagnostic) dataset')
plt.xlabel('mean area')
plt.ylabel('mean smoothness')
plt.show()
```
